definition[0]: a price that does not take account of inflation
example[0]: Whereas oilâ€™s nominal price remained stable, its real price fell during this period.
definition[1]: a price that does not represent the real cost or value of something
example[1]: Meals were available to the unemployed at a nominal price.
definition[2]: the stated price that appears on a bond etc. Bonds are often sold slightly above or below a nominal price of 100
